intro: Annona uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower custard apple, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows up to 5 meters in height. The plant produces large, showy flowers with a single, prominent bloom, which is characteristic of its species. Its fruit, which resembles a pear or apple in shape, is edible and has a sweet, creamy flavor. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
